titles.title: Prohibiting Members of the House of Representatives from using the frank for unsolicited mailings.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on House Administration.
Referred to the House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service.
Referred to the House Committee on Rules.

committee.name: House Post Office and Civil Service

bill.summary: 6/9/1993--Introduced. Prohibits a Member of the House of Representatives from using the frank for mail other than mail: (1) in direct response to a communication from the person to whom the mail is addressed; (2) from the Member to another Member of Congress or a Federal, State, or local government official; (3) of a news release to the communications media; or (4) in furtherance of the administrative duties of the Member.
